question_text: Which of the following statements is true regarding SO-DIMM use in performance-critical systems?
answer_options: SO-DIMMs are ideal due to higher thermal limits
SO-DIMMs are interchangeable with full-sized DIMMs in most desktops
SO-DIMMs offer less physical bandwidth due to compact size and fewer electrical contacts
SO-DIMMs use proprietary bus standards incompatible with standard motherboards
correct_answer: SO-DIMMs offer less physical bandwidth due to compact size and fewer electrical contacts
explanation: SO-DIMMs are more compact and suited for laptops, but their smaller form factor often limits total bandwidth compared to full-sized DIMMs.
